intro: Duhamelia axillaris, commonly known as the axillary duhamelia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, pink or purple flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are alternate and ovate, often with serrated edges. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats.
